meanings.definition: Deids (noun): plural form of deid, meaning dead bodies
meanings.sent1: The graveyard was filled with deids.
meanings.sent2: The authorities had to remove the deids from the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: The spooky haunted house was rumored to be haunted by deids.
meanings.sent4: The battlefield was a sea of deids after the fierce battle.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie was full of terrifying deids.

meanings.definition: Deids (verb): third person singular present of deid, meaning dies
meanings.sent1: He deids peacefully in his sleep.
meanings.sent3: The old car finally deids on the side of the road.
meanings.sent4: His hope deids a little more with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The flame deids out as the wind blows stronger.

meanings.definition: Deids (adjective): relating to death or the dead
meanings.sent1: The deids silence of the cemetery was eerie.
meanings.sent2: The deids flowers adorned the gravestones.
meanings.sent3: The deids cat seemed to bring bad luck wherever it went.
meanings.sent4: The deids atmosphere of the abandoned house sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent5: The deids pallor of his skin indicated a serious illness.
